court_jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction over tort claims against individual prison officers based on federal law
relevant_rule: statutory grant of jurisdiction by Parliament
existing body of federal law nourishes this grant
case is based on 'a law of Canada'
application_context: claims rooted in tortious liability rather than federal law
Penitentiary Service Regulations regulate operational matters
decision_reasoning: Plaintiff's claims do not arise from federal law
result_of_case: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction over individual defendants
cause_of_action: Plaintiff filed claims against prison officials for actions during his segregation and transfer process
procedure_followed: Defendants moved to strike the claim due to lack of jurisdiction
